details.title: Why is IELTS Grammar important?
details.description: Examiners pay special attention even to the tiniest dots a commas you place in your IELTS answers. So it goes without saying, having a bad grammar will lessen your odds of receiving an acceptable score. Find out more on why grammar is so important in the IELTS examination

details.title: Common mistakes students make in IELTS Grammar
details.description: Usage of a semi-colon and a comma is one of the most confusing and the most erroneous part of most IELTS answers. Watch and find out more about such common mistakes and how to avoid them in your answers.

details.title: Grammar tips
details.description: There are shortcuts you can use to boost your score on the grammatical front? Do you think

details.title: Regular and Irregular Verbs
details.description:
Inflection of a verb that follows a typical pattern is known as a regular verb. An ordinary verb's past tense is generated by adding a -ed ending to it: walk, walked. Watch this video to know all about regular verbs.

Do you Know what a regular verb is? What if we knew and are ready to share it with you through this video?  Take a look and find out for yourself.

details.title: Pronouns
details.description: Tired of using the same nouns in your essay? Wouldn’t it be better if there was a substitute to it? Well there are a few. Let’s have a look at them and their usage in this video.

details.title: Simple Present Tense
details.description: When something is happening right now or on a regular basis, we use the simple present tense to describe it. This video will tell you everything you need to know about simple present tense.

details.title: Present Continuous Tense
details.description: The present continuous verb tense denotes that something is happening right now, on a regular basis, and may continue in the future and this video will tell you exactly how to use this tense in the correct manner.

details.title: Present Perfect Tense
details.description:
This video is all about present perfect tenses. The present perfect tense describes an activity that occurred at an undetermined point in the past or that started in the past and persisted until now.
(e.g., he has grown taller over the last 4 months)

details.title: Simple Past- Tense
details.description: We have created a video on simple past tense. Would you like to have a look? Watch and learn the correct usage of words to describe some action that has happened in the past.

details.title: Past Continuous
details.description: The Past Continuous tense is an important tense in English. We use it to say what we were in the middle of doing at a particular moment in the past.

details.title: Past perfect
details.description: Used mostly to describe an action that has finished at some point of time in the past, past perfect tense or pluperfect tense are some of the most commonly used tenses in the English language. Let’s find out how to use them appropriately in this video.

details.title: Simple future
details.description: Would like to talk about the forecasted effects of global warming in your essay? Or maybe a plan you have for the future in your speaking part 2 of the speaking assessment? This video is all about properly talking about the future. Watch on and find out the usages of simple future tenses.

details.title: Active and Passive voice
details.description:
“You are about to watch this video on sentences in active voice”, let's take a look at how a sentence looks in active voice.

“A video on sentences in passive voice is about to be watched by you”, let's learn how to convert sentences in active voice into passive voice through this video.

details.title: Definite article- the
details.description: The definite article (the) is used before a noun to indicate that the identity of the noun is known to the reader.

details.title: Indefinite article- a, an
details.description: The indefinite article (a, an) is used before a noun that is general or when its identity is not known.

details.title: Prepositions
details.description:
“There is a vampire”
“Where?”
“Behind you”

Thank god for prepositions right? Now we know where the danger lays! 
Let’s have a closer look at prepositions in this video.

details.title: Sentence Construction- Simple, Compound and Complex
details.description: An excellent essay is created by combining simple, compound and complex sentences. So, in this video, we'll take a look at the final part of that combination.

details.title: Punctuation(Full stop, comma, semicolon, capital and small letters)
details.description: Messing up your punctuations is one of the worst mistakes a candidate can make in his or her written answer as examiners take note of this very quickly. Seems scary right? No worries! We have you covered with this video.

details.title: Connectors
details.description: Using simple connectors will contribute to an acceptable band score BUT using complex ones will get you a great band score. Can you use connectors appropriately? Let’s find out in this video.
